messageBody:

> we use it
> > here to launch our suite of Swing based client apps. I
> would like to
> > test successful downloading and launching of the apps from
> the server
> > via WebStart, I guess I am looking for WebStartUnit...
>
> I think you are /writing/ WebStartUnit... although not necessarily.
>
> Use me as a virtual pair. Describe how you would test this manually.
> --

J.B.,

What I would ideally like is a means to specify from a unit test
the URL of a WebStart app. to launch, then get back some indication
of whether it launched OK, or some error codes if something went wrong.
Currently we have to test this manually by clicking on each app's
link on the WebStart page and verifying the app. is downloaded
and launched successfully.

I've already written some HTTPUnit tests which test following the links
on our WebStart apps homepage, verifying they're valid and
return JNLP files when clicked. I'd like to test more than this however
as more than a few times we've
seen problems such as JAR signing problems, library version mismatches
etc.
which have caused the WebStart launch to fail. I'm aware that this
may be more in the realm of integration testing than unit testing as
such.

Any more ideas would be appreciated,
Thanks,
Sean
